page.title: 08Language
page.content: The language spoken in the area of Keig is the dialect known technically as North East Scots and locally as "The Doric". It is the North East Scots variant of the Scots language which has become progressively fragmented since the break up of the Scots national identity following the Union with England in 1603 and more particularly the Union of the Parliaments in 1707. In this area the old language flourishes with a rich vocabulary aand strong regional accent. It can pose quite a problem of communication to English speakers new to the district but, as both the Scots and English languages come from common Anglo Saxon roots, any incomer with a little ingenuity can soon identify certain peculiarities which makes understanding easier.(See next page for examples).
